column1: Small businesses have suffered tremendously in the wake of #COVID19. Let’s do our part to ensure our favorite small businesses are able to keep their doors/websites open by shopping with them for #SmallBusinessSaturday.
Rep. Al Green joins Mayor Turner and the Cactus Jack Foundation in Sunnyside at Worthing High School in passing out 1000 turkeys and free COVID testing. https://t.co/4qFx9qTRk9

A happy first day of school should be safe. Many schools will open their doors today w/o much needed equipment to mitigate COVID-19 spread. The Senate must pass the Heroes Act which includes $58B for K-12 schools. The lives of students faculty & staff could depend on it.

Labor Day is not a random day off; it’s the recognition of unions' labor and strategic persistent organizing. As we enjoy this day let's thank our local unions for their efforts to ensure employers offer a safe fair work environment for all even during COVID-19. #LaborDay2020

Just as wearing seatbelts saves lives wearing masks saves lives. You can put yourself in harm’s way but you have no right to transfer that harm to others. There have been more than 5M COVID-19 cases and 160K+ deaths in the U.S. This virus kills. Save lives. 🗣WEAR YOUR MASK
Tune in now to the @HomelandDems hearing on “Examining the National Response to the Worsening Coronavirus Pandemic: Part II.”   https://t.co/XHt8IIRky1

HAPPENING NOW: @FSCDems is discussing expanding capital and financial access for women and minority-owned businesses during and beyond the #coronavirus pandemic. Join the LIVE virtual hearing here: https://t.co/dO8gQ5qG4F.

Join me now with the @homelanddems for our LIVE virtual hearing “Examining the National Response to the Worsening Coronavirus Pandemic.” I’m introducing Dr. Shah from @hcphtx now. He’ll shed light on this national pandemic. Tune in!

#COVIDー19 “totally harmless”Mr. President? Ask the loved ones of the 129K+ victims in our country who’ve lost their lives due to this virus. During this pandemic crisis you consistently fail to provide coherent effective leadership. Either lead follow or get out of the way!

As Texas and other states see their highest numbers of #COVID19 cases the President asks #SCOTUS to invalidate the Affordable Care Act. This disgraceful President would see an estimated 20 million Americans w/o healthcare coverage during a pandemic in favor of his own interests.
Watch @FSCDems address “America’s Renters and the Housing Impact of COVID-19” LIVE here:   https://t.co/61DQV86o5c
Hope you’re tuned in to “Coronavirus and Homeland Security Part Five: A Panel Discussion on Health Disparities with Dean Michelle Williams and Samantha Artiga.” https://t.co/mS2Y7BYk8S

To whom it may concern: If we know that African-American communities have a disproportionate concentration of deaths due to coronavirus why aren't we concentrating more of our response on combating coronavirus in African-American communities? #BlackLivesMatter
After making this statement on the House Floor last week President Trump has #finally decided to limit his participation in coronavirus press conferences. #AtLast https://t.co/ETRNvY9JMb
Missed my House Floor speech on the next #coronavirus relief measure? Watch it here: https://t.co/Zw6QW5bkZF
Hope you are watching the House Floor on @cspan. I'll be sharing my thoughts on the next #coronavirus relief measure soon.

Increasing mobile testing units in vulnerable communities would help us to track and mitigate the spread of COVID-19. @RepSylviaGarcia & I are fighting for mobile testing units in communities that need it most. Read our statement here: https://t.co/1TPKMnvk9K
Thank you @HarrisCoJudge & @houmayor for your courageous leadership during the #coronavirus pandemic.

As we commemorate #Passover #Easter and #Ramadan both now and in days to come remember that these sacred holidays will be best spent at home protecting our loved ones and people across our nation from #COVIDー19.   We must all work to flatten the curve and defeat coronavirus.
Tune in LIVE. I’m on discussing the alarming disproportionate death rates of African Americans due to COVID-19. https://t.co/hUTVNKMFb1

.@realDonaldTrump in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic America needs leadership now more than ever during your presidency. Refusing to work with and then firing the Inspector General just adds to your track record of dishonorable conduct.   Do the honorable thing - RESIGN.
If you have a small business that has been impacted by #COVID19 join us TOMORROW at 12 noon CST to learn about the opportunities for which your business may qualify. https://t.co/tTENPLOZ7b
Proud to support the $2T emergency COVID-19 relief package the CARES Act which has passed the House today. For my detailed thoughts on the bill visit my website here: https://t.co/yCQSLpmBfo
I'm headed back to Washington D.C. to vote on the CARES Act. I am proud to continue to fight for the needs of my constituents and all Americans during this unprecedented #COVID19 crisis.
I traveled to Washington D.C. to introduce 3 bills for the next #coronavirus response package. For exclusive coverage on my experience please read here:  https://t.co/KvHjcOPFCi

To whom it may concern  Decisions about going back to business as usual during a pandemic should be medical NOT political. We should rely on Dr. Fauci‘s medical expertise regarding #COVID19 NOT President Trump’s political whims. #NotDying4WallStreet
Missed the LIVE press conference? Here are my thoughts on the opening of the first city-county drive thru #COVID19 testing site in Houston. #HoustonStrong https://t.co/rKV44Ju2Fu

There are people who are suffering. I extend my prayers and my concerns for all who are suffering from #COVID19. This is a time of great need for a good many people. This is what the government is for. The government is for the people during a time of crisis.

My proposal for offering 0% loans to minority banks was adopted today as part of @RepMaxineWaters’ COVID-19 relief package. @FSCDems are hard at work on economic relief for all of our communities during this time of hardship. https://t.co/HVQjOfZRbp

🚨IMPORTANT #COVID2019 UPDATE🚨 Effective immediately my congressional staff will practice social distancing by teleworking as a result of COVID-19. We urge you to take the necessary precautions to protect your health and the health of others.   https://t.co/6GG5JZ6BIj

An impeached president who's been exposed to #coronavirus but does not get tested while encouraging others to be tested for the virus is worse than a bad example. He is unfit and constantly shows us why he should have been removed from office by the Senate. #CoronaVirusUpdates

While @RODEOHOUSTON is an annual attraction that I'm proud to hold in the 9th Congressional District of TX I'm supportive of the decision to close due to COVID-19 concerns. We must take the risks seriously & exercise extreme caution to ensure the health & safety of the public.

Mr. President blaming CNN for reporting news and Democratic politicians for speaking out is more propaganda than a plan when it comes to dealing with the coronavirus. PLEASE let the healthcare experts take the lead on this one. Too much is at stake. #hoax
Going live in Houston to discuss novel #coronavirus with local public health officials & community leaders. Hope you’ll be watching.
